thread.title: H.S. boys soccer: Around the pitch for Oct. 21 - Boys Soccer
thread.title_full: H.S. boys soccer: Around the pitch for Oct. 21 - Boys Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: H.S. boys soccer: Around the pitch for Oct. 21 - Boys Soccer
text:
Around the pitch 
* Eighth-seeded Pascack Valley and 10th-seeded Northern Highlands have each played their way into the Bergen County tournament semifinals Saturday night at Indian Hills along with higher seeds Tenafly (third) and Ramapo (fourth). 
Pascack Valley (9-3) is coming off a stunning 3-2 double-overtime victory over top-seeded Bergen Catholic in the BCT quarterfinals Sunday. Northern Highlands (11-2) surprised second-seeded Bergen Tech, 2-1, rallying by the Knights in the quarterfinals on second-half goals by Sam Moscowitz and Christian Virgona.
Veteran coach Roy Nygren's Indians from Hillsdale will play fourth-seeded Ramapo (11-1), the defending champion, in the BCT semifinal nightcap at 7 p.m. In the first game, coach Steve Every's Highlanders will take on Tenafly at 4:30 p.m. The Tigers (9-1-2) turned back Garfield, 2-1, when Romero Morales scored 17 seconds into sudden-death overtime. The winners will advance to the BCT championship game Oct. 30 at Ramapo High School at 7 p.m.
* Harrison was eliminated from the Hudson County tournament semifinals Sunday at Bayonne when the fourth-seeded Blue Tide were defeated by top-seeded Kearny, 3-0. However, Harrison (13-3) will be one of the favorites in Group 2 when the state tournament begins in early November. 
* Liam Lilienthal scored three goals and had an assist to propel Pequannock past Butler, 6-0, in a Northwest Jersey Athletic Conference Independence Division game Friday. J.T. Couch had a goal and two assists and Bill Troast had eight saves to record the shutout.
* Kinnelon has posted three straight shutout victories – 5-0 over Butler on Wednesday, 3-0 over Morris Knolls on Friday and 4-0 over Morris Catholic on Monday. Junior Greg Poposki had two goals in the win over Butler and had a goal and two assists against Morris Catholic and Drew Thiem had a goal and two assists in the Morris Knolls game. Sophomore Steven Kleczkowski combined for three goals and an assist in the three games.
* Secaucus dealt Harrison its first NJIC Division Liberty loss of the season Monday when the Patriots surprised the Blue Tide, 4-1, behind two assists from Robert Walshe and a goal and an assist from Sean Boyle. 
* Senior Conor McDonnell scored three goals and had two assists and sophomore Colin McDonnell had two goals and two assists for Bogota leading the Buccaneers past Palisades Park, 8-1, on Monday. 
* Senior forward Faisal Haddad scored in the first scheduled 10-minute sudden-death overtime to give Wood-Ridge a dramatic 3-2 victory over Becton in an NJIC Meadowlands Division game Monday. Haddad and Ariel Silva each had a goal and an assist, Thomas Fischkelta had a goal and Joseph Sartori made 13 saves for the Blue Devils.
* Sophomore Nicholas Navarro scored three goals and junior Art Gega had a goal and an assist to help Boonton (10-6-1) defeat Butler, 7-1, in an NWJAC game Monday. 
(All records and statistics are through Monday)
— Ed Mills
